pullRequest.title: [docs] Fix wrong required properties for HDFS2 sink
pullRequest.bodyText:
Motivation
From HdfsSinkConfig.validate method in org.apache.pulsar.io.hdfs2.sink, fileExtension (if compression is None) and filenamePrefix are required, but the documents marked them as not required.
Modifications
Fix the required properties and modify example configs.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change | `filenamePrefix` |String| true if `compression` is None | None |The prefix of the files created inside the HDFS directory.

**Example**
The value of topicA result in files named topicA-. | | `filenamePrefix` |String| true, if `compression` is set to `None`. | None |The prefix of the files created inside the HDFS directory.

**Example**
The value of topicA result in files named topicA-. |
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -21,8 +21,8 @@ The configuration of the HDFS2 sink connector has the following properties. | `compression` | Compression |false |None |The compression code used to compress or de-compress the files on HDFS.

Below are the available options:
  • BZIP2
  • DEFLATE
  • GZIP
  • LZ4
  • SNAPPY| | `kerberosUserPrincipal` |String| false| None|The principal account of Kerberos user used for authentication. | | `keytab` | String|false|None| The full pathname of the Kerberos keytab file used for authentication. | -| `filenamePrefix` |String| false |None |The prefix of the files created inside the HDFS directory.

    **Example**
    The value of topicA result in files named topicA-. | -| `fileExtension` | String| false | None| The extension added to the files written to HDFS.

    **Example**
    '.txt'
    '.seq' | +| `filenamePrefix` |String| true if `compression` is None | None |The prefix of the files created inside the HDFS directory.

    **Example**
    The value of topicA result in files named topicA-. |

commit.message: Fix wrong required properties for HDFS2 sink

beforeCommit.message: Fix wrong required properties for HDFS2 sink
